message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a fantastic opportunity for you to acquire a unique asset. I'm willing to offer it to you for $950000.

I appreciate your enthusiasm, Alice, but I was thinking more along the lines of $850000. I'm really interested in the product, but I need to stay within my budget. Can you consider meeting me at this price?

Bob, I understand your budget constraints, but I'm afraid I won't be able to meet you at $850000. However, I'm willing to make a compromise. I can offer it to you for $900000. This is the lowest I can go, and I think it's a fair price considering the product's value to you.

I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my target. I'd like to make another counteroffer of $870000. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value to me, and I'm willing to meet you halfway.

Bob, I understand you're trying to meet me halfway, but I'm still not comfortable with $870000. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer it to you for $885000. This is the last time I'll be willing to negotiate, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

I appreciate your last offer, Alice, but I'm afraid I'll have to decline. I'm still interested in the product, but I need to stay within my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $870000, as I mentioned earlier. Can we agree on that price?

Bob, I've already offered you the best price I can, and I'm not willing to go any lower. However, I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a 5-year warranty and a complimentary maintenance package, which will add significant value to the product. Considering this, I'm willing to meet you at $875000. This is my final offer.

Alice, I appreciate the extras you're offering, but I'm still not willing to meet you at $875000. I'm willing to walk away if we can't agree on a price. I'll make one final offer of $870000, and I expect it to be accepted. If not, I'll have to explore other options.
